definitions.definition: ( nautical ) The tiller (or, in a large ship , the wheel ) which is used to control the rudder of a marine vessel ; also, the entire steering apparatus of a vessel.

subdefinitions.definition: ( nautical ) The use of a helm (sense 1) ; also, the amount of space through which a helm is turned .
( nautical ) The member of a vessel's crew in charge of steering the vessel; a helmsman or helmswoman .
Something used to control or steer; also ( obsolete ) , a handle of a tool or weapon ; a haft , a helve .
A position of control or leadership .
One in the position of controlling or directing ; a controller , a director , a guide .

main_definition: ( nautical ) The tiller (or, in a large ship , the wheel ) which is used to control the rudder of a marine vessel ; also, the entire steering apparatus of a vessel.

definitions.definition: ( Can we verify this sense?) ( heraldry ) Synonym of helmet ( “ the feature above a shield on a coat of arms ” ) .

subdefinitions.definition: ( Northern England ) A shelter for cattle or other farm animals ; a hemmel , a shed .
( Northern England ( Cumberland , Westmorland ) ) A heavy cloud lying on the brow of a mountain , especially one associated with a storm .
( obsolete ) ( except British , dialectal ) The crown or top of something. ( alchemy , chemistry ) The upper part or cap of an alembic or retort .

secondary_definitions: ( Can we verify this sense?) ( heraldry ) Synonym of helmet ( “ the feature above a shield on a coat of arms ” ) .

definitions.definition: A stalk of corn , or ( uncountable ) stalks of corn collectively (that is, straw ), especially when bundled together or laid out straight to be used for thatching roofs .
Alternative form of haulm ( “ the stems of various cultivated plants , left after harvesting the crop , which are used as animal food or litter , or for thatching ” ) .
Synonym of bentgrass (“any of numerous reedy grass species of the genus Agrostis ”)

main_definition: ( countable ) A stalk of corn , or ( uncountable ) stalks of corn collectively (that is, straw ), especially when bundled together or laid out straight to be used for thatching roofs .
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) Alternative form of haulm ( “ the stems of various cultivated plants , left after harvesting the crop , which are used as animal food or litter , or for thatching ” ) .
( uncountable , obsolete ) Synonym of bentgrass (“any of numerous reedy grass species of the genus Agrostis ”)
